verse.roman:
tatropaviṣṭam ṛṣibhiḥ
kalāpa-grāma-vāsibhiḥ
parītaṁ praṇato 'pṛcchad
idam eva kurūdvaha

synonyms: tatra—there; upaviṣṭam—sitting; ṛṣibhiḥ—by sages; kalāpa-grāma—in the village Kalāpa (nearby Badarikāśrama); vāsibhiḥ—who resided; parītam—surrounded; praṇataḥ—bowing down; apṛcchat—he asked; idam eva—this same (question); kuru-udvaha—O most eminent of the Kurus.
translation: There Nārada approached Lord Nārāyaṇa Ṛṣi, who was sitting amidst sages of the village of Kalāpa. After bowing down to the Lord, O hero of the Kurus, Nārada asked Him the very same question you have asked me.
